snippet: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed suggested that Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, who is on trial in Manhattan, was enlisted to make fiery speeches for Al Qaeda because he was “an eloquent, spellbinding speaker.”
abstract: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, key planner of Sept 11 terrorist attacks, suggests in filed court statement that Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, who is on trial in Manhattan, had no role in military operations for Al Qaeda; asserts that Abu Ghaith was instead enlisted to make fiery speeches for group because he was 'an eloquent, spellbinding speaker.'
lead_paragraph: Khalid Shaikh Mohammed suggested that Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, who is on trial in Manhattan, was enlisted to make fiery speeches for Al Qaeda because he was “an eloquent, spellbinding speaker.”

headline.main: 9/11 Architect Says Bin Laden’s Son-in-Law Had No Role in Qaeda Military Operations
headline.print_headline: 9/11 Architect Says Bin Laden Aide Had No Role in Qaeda Military
